column3: Tend to NACK here. This serves as documentation, indicating that the (large) scope is indeed the scope of a loop.
Tend to agree with NACK. This code is anyway a bit too long so `continue` can help to read.
I think a comment at the end of the scope might serve as better documentation ( // End while loop ). A continue does not provide this information IMHO.
> A continue does not provide this information IMHO.\n\nIt does. It is even compile-time enforced documentation, in contrast to a comment, which easily gets outdated.
I'm indifferent to the outcome but it's not a compile-time enforced documentation.\nIt's bikeshedding at this point.

>>A continue does not provide this information IMHO.

>It does. It is even compile-time enforced documentation, in contrast to a comment, which easily gets outdated.

Can you check if compiler generates the same code in both cases ?
I meant that the compiler will error out, if you place a `continue` at the end of a random non-loop scope.
